citations.narrative:
During inspection the APHIS official observed multiple floor areas in need of repair in the indoor housing facility in the
kennel rooms holding multiple cats and dogs. The primary enclosures of the indoor housing facility holding dogs have
damaged epoxy floor areas where porous concrete is in contact with the animals. The floor was previously sealed with
epoxy, but areas have peeled off and have exposed the porous concrete. The areas exposed range from approximately 3
inches to 15 inches long. The cat room also had exposed porous concrete areas that varied in size approximately from 10
inches to 14 inches long.
Surfaces that are permeable to moisture cannot be properly cleaned and/or sanitized, which can negatively affect animal
health. The floor must be impervious to moisture to allow proper cleaning and sanitation. The floors and walls of indoor
housing facilities, and any other surfaces in contact with the animals, must be impervious to moisture.
Correct by: September 30, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
